byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

abstract: Islamic religious scholars, governments, museums and international preservationists denounce destruction of Iraq's archaeological treasures by members of Islamic State; note while many large artifacts have been destroyed, smaller items have been looted by fighters for sale on black market.
lead_paragraph: Archaeologists despaired that the Islamic State aimed to systematically destroy the relics at a wellspring of civilization.

headline.main: ISIS Bulldozing of Ancient Nimrud Site in Iraq Stirs Outrage
headline.print_headline: Site of ISIS Vandalism Ranks Among World’s Most Important for Archaeologists

snippet: Archaeologists despaired that the Islamic State aimed to systematically destroy the relics at a wellspring of civilization.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
